content.div:
How is Bobbi Kristina Brown? Oprah Winfrey will get the answer. Since Whitney Houston's death nearly one month ago, the late singer's only child has become a topic of gossip and concern, but the young singer will speak to Winfrey as part of a special airing on the TV mogul's OWN network March 11, the one-month anniversary of Houston's passing.

The program was taped Friday, the New York Daily News reports, two days before Brown's 19th birthday. Houston's sister-in-law/manager Patricia Houston and brother Gary Houston are also expected to appear (and hug Oprah at least 3.5 times within the hour), and though previews of the interview haven't been released, program descriptions suggest the family will share their remembrances of Houston, and address the speculation surrounding the Bodyguard diva's cause of death.

Houston's body was discovered in the bathtub of her Beverly Hills Hilton hotel room Feb. 11, and though a variety of reports have suggested prescription pills were to blame, toxicology results are still pending and an official cause of death has yet to be released.

Winfrey, who was invited to the vocalist's New Jersey funeral last month, last interviewed Houston in 2009. That vintage Q&A will be replayed at 7 p.m. ET March 11, leading into the new interview, set to air at 9 p.m.

leahc@dose.ca
